fact_list.fact_text: Electric powered motorcycles and scooters are plug-in-electric vehicles with two or three wheels.
The electricity is stored onboard in a rechargeable battery, which drives one or more electric motors.
Electric powered motorcycles and scooters are generally of the same size and weight and are comparable in performance with petrol-driven motorcycles.
The features of the electric motorcycles are similar to the petrol engine motorcycles.
Electric motorcycles generally have the same operating functions such as brakes, mirrors, lights, and others.
The only difference is that electric motorcycles run on automatic transmission gear without having a clutch which is used for manual transmission motorcycles.
Some petrol engine motorcycles and scooters presently run on automatic transmission.
Electric motorcycles have better acceleration as they develop higher torque.
Generally, electric motorcycles weigh lighter and have a low engine noise.
Although the electric motorcycle's features and operations are quite similar to petrol engine motorcycles, riders should accustom themselves to the electric motorcycle's faster acceleration.
General road safety rules should be followed when riding an electric motorcycle.
